author: BASIN GIRL

review: Bought this for my 14 year-old step son who has the only TV in the house that is not a Smart TV. We love amazon products and own many of them so we decided to chose this product just because of their proven reputation. Once again, this product is a really great product. It is very easy to set up right out of the box and we have not had any issues at all with it. My step-son taught himself how to navigate through it and he is an big Netflix fan so with that alone, we are thankful. Just wait until he becomes interested with all of the many other apps it comes with....he hasn't even touched the surface...LOL. But he is happy with what he likes so we are happy.
author: TiiWill

review: I debated for a long time ordering the Fire Stick. I compared it to the roku and chrome and ultimately decided on the stick. So far it's been working great. I love that it has tons of apps, as I don't watch too much of the prime TV and movies. A small downside for me, the shows and movies currently offered for prime wouldn't be my first choice but it updates often.
author: S. Avery

review: Checked the blogs and was excited about a low-cost streaming technology from a major player like Amazon.  But, the rumors are not true.  KODI 14.2 or 15.0 cannot be downloaded onto the TV Fire Stick according to Amazon customer service a moment ago.  Any downloadable apps must come from Amazon and they only have a decrepit old version of XBMC from 2012.  Shame that they want to prevent us all from the best Movie and TV streaming application in the world.  Better luck next time.... Amazon​ sells many devices for less than $100 which offer the ability to download KODI and Genesis and many other scrapers.

review: Wish there was just an off button instead of having to hold the button to sleep.
